page.title: 10NEWSPAPERS IN RADSTOCK.
page.content: The Somerset Guardian is a weekly publication that comes out every Friday.The main story of the week gets to the front page.This story could be printed as late as 3'oclock on Thursday.There are two full time reporters and news that comes from the public.The subeditor decides the paper but the editor has the final say.The paper takes a week to put together. The Somerset Guardian was first published on January 13 1894.The paper is not printed in Radstock but in Bath.The circulation of the paper is Radstock and district, printing 10000 copies a week. The only financial problem experienced has been with advertisements.The paper needs advertisements to help keep costs down.If no adverts were received the paper would cost Â£5 instead of 18p.
